description: If the first input to the command is a specific fixel data file, then a filtered version of only that file will be generated by the command. Alternatively, if the input is the location of a fixel directory, then the command will create a duplicate of the fixel directory, and apply the specified filter operation to all fixel data files within the directory.

arguments.description: the input: either a fixel data file, or a fixel directory (see Description)
the filtering operation to perform; options are: connect, smooth
the output: either a fixel data file, or a fixel directory (see Description)

options.description: provide a fixel-fixel connectivity matrix for filtering operations that require it
specify a threshold for the input fixel data file values (default = 0.5)
specify a fixel-fixel connectivity threshold for connected-component analysis (default = 0.10000000000000001)
the full-width half-maximum (FWHM) of the spatial component of the smoothing filter (default = 10mm)
apply a minimum threshold to smoothing weights (default = 0.01)
only perform smoothing within a specified binary fixel mask
do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.
force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).
use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).
temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
display this information page and exit.
